medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty with handwriting and motor problems in the right leg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five months prior, starting with numbness and a sensation of swelling in the feet, persisting without obvious edema. Three days before admission, the patient experienced subtle difficulty in steering his automobile, followed by awkward handwriting, a clumsy right foot while walking, and difficulty solving simple mathematical problems. Symptoms progressed over two days until hospital admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension and gout; left nephrectomy at age 11 due to ureteral stricture; recent left-leg vein stripping procedure.
medical_history.family_history: A son has a problem with a ureter, but no surgical treatment advised.
medical_history.social_history: Consumes three beers nightly; has a 45-pack-year smoking history, having stopped smoking a year prior to admission.
